program.name: Children's Medical Security Plan (CMSP)
program.description_short: Low-cost health coverage for uninsured MA children under 19
program.description:
The Children's Medical Security Plan (CMSP) provides low-cost health coverage for children under age 19 who live in Massachusetts and are currently uninsured.

CMSP helps pay for regular checkups, sick visits, prescriptions, and some specialty care.

To qualify, a child must:
- Be under age 19
- Live in Massachusetts
- Currently have no health insurance

There is no income limit — families at any income level may qualify. There is no citizenship requirement — undocumented children are eligible.

Note: If your child may also qualify for MassHealth, apply for MassHealth first, as it provides more comprehensive coverage.
program.website_description: Low-cost health coverage for uninsured Massachusetts children under 19

warning_message.message: There may be a waiting list to receive CMSP coverage.
